highSignals: Explicit methodology keywords: qualitative, ethnography, grounded theory, discourse analysis, narrative inquiry, phenomenology, interviews, focus groups, participatory research, CBPR, oral history, thematic analysis, case study research
Fields with strong qualitative foundations: sociology, anthropology, social work, communication studies, education research, nursing research, medical humanities, social epidemiology

Research topics requiring human-centered methods: stigma, lived experience, identity, families, communities, health equity/disparities, violence prevention, child welfare, sexual/reproductive health, LGBTQ+ health, trauma, migration, racism, public health, psychology, pharma trials, disorders in underserved populations

Participatory and community language: partnering with communities, community-based, centering voices, underserved/marginalized populations, co-production, collaborative research, health care access, equity, advocacy combined with research
Academic research leadership roles with population focus: PI, lab director, center director, research scientist studying human populations
Sensitive population research requiring IRB and participant management: HIV/AIDS, mental health, suicide/self-harm, child abuse, sexual health, immigration, incarceration
Explicit affiliation with university, lab, or academic medical center
Research staff at academic institutions working on human-subjects studies (coordinators, specialists at university hospitals/research centers)
lowSignals: Pure clinical roles: MD, fellow, resident focused solely on patient care with no research mention
Quantitative-primary fields without human-subjects component: biostatistics, data science, computational methods, bioinformatics
Theoretical-only scholars: pure bioethicists, postcolonial literary theorists, STS theorists without empirical fieldwork
Advocacy + academic affiliation but unclear if conducting research vs policy/clinical work
Activism without any academic or research affiliation
Policy analysts without fieldwork or participant research
No research connection whatsoever (sports, journalist, marketer, influencer, etc.)
Empty or vague bio with no actionable information
nullSignals: Physician-researchers: MD at academic medical center with research interests or population health focus, but no explicit qualitative methodology
Epidemiologists or public health researchers without clear qualitative vs quantitative indication
Faculty in adjacent fields (e.g., gastroenterology, nephrology) studying underserved populations or access issues
Research coordinators/specialists at academic institutions - likely supports qualitative work but role unclear
Fellow or resident at academic medical center with research interests mentioned
domainContext: Target profiles conduct or support human-subjects research requiring: participant recruitment and tracking, interview/focus group scheduling, transcription services (including multilingual), IRB/HIPPA compliance documentation, secure storage for sensitive qualitative data, and team collaboration on coding/analysis. They study populations and phenomena through direct human interaction - interviews, observations, focus groups. Include research coordinators/specialists at universities or academic hospitals who directly support qualitative studies.
notes: null = actionable lead with ambiguous fit (worth manual review or nurture campaign). Previous version marked these as false, losing potential customers. Key null cases: epidemiologists, clinical faculty studying populations, research coordinators. Empty/vague bios are now false (no signal to act on). [Final System Prompt: 840 tokens]
